data.title: Apple Credit Card To Make Apple Pay Stronger Rival To PayPal, Square
data.text:
Apple's new credit card doesn't spell trouble for established networks like Visa but could make Apple's digital wallet a stronger rival to PayPal's Venmo and Square Cash, one analyst says.

data.title: Analyst, who recently advised selling Apple stock, says China tariff risk was not the reason
data.text: An analyst from Rosenblatt Securities told CNBC on Wednesday that the firm downgraded Apple not because of China tariffs but for reasons relating to Apple's slow growth in production sales and 5G networks.

data.title: Apple's $6 Billion And Streaming's Content Space Race
data.text: Apple reportedly will spend $6 billion for original programming to fuel its upcoming Apple TV+ service. Add that to Netflix's $15 billion, Amazon Prime Video's $5 billion and all others -- and you have media's new content-driven Space Race.

data.title: Apple plans to tap China's BOE Technology for advanced iPhone screens: Nikkei
data.text: Apple Inc  is in the final stages of certifying advanced screens from Chinese display maker BOE Technology Group Co Ltd  for its iPhones, as it attempts to reduce reliance on Samsung Electronics, the Nikkei reported on Wednesday.

data.title: Apple TV+'s Plus-Size Content Budget

data.title: Apple is turning to a Chinese firm for premium iPhone screens, report says
data.text: The Nikkei, citing sources, said that Apple was "aggressively testing" BOE's flexible organic light-emitting diode (OLED) displays.
